definition: to rack one's brains (for apt wording etc) (idiom)
to search
to search/to demand/to ask/to exact/large rope/isolated
surname Suo/abbr. for 索馬里|索马里[Suo3 ma3 li3], Somalia
dried up
intestines
old variant of 腸|肠[chang2]

sentences.english: The so - called poet ground out some verses.
sentences.chinese: 这个所谓的诗人搜索枯肠做成几句诗。

sentences.english: He had racked his brain, but hadnrt been able to work out the answer to the problem.
sentences.chinese: 他已经搜索枯肠了，可是仍未找到答题的谜底。

sentences.english: She racked her poor brains to have the laugh on me.
sentences.chinese: 她搜索枯肠来嘲笑我了。

sentences.english: Mr. Godfrey made an effort, and came out with a new version of the affair.
sentences.chinese: 高孚利先生搜索枯肠，终于想出一种新的说法。

sentences.english: After fishing for right word, I decided to look in the dictionary.
sentences.chinese: 我搜索枯肠寻找一个恰当的字不得，决定查字典。

sentences.english: We'll have to rack our brain and think of some effective measures.
sentences.chinese: 我们得搜索枯肠想出一些卓有成效的措施。

definition: to search one's guts and belly (idiom); to racks one's brains for a solution
to consider from all angles (idiom); to think hard/to rack one's brains
to consider from all angles (idiom); to think hard/to rack one's brains
to mull over (idiom)/to think long and hard
brains
to tweak one's ears and scratch one's cheeks (as an expression of anxiety, delight, frustration etc) (idiom)
to fail to grasp the main points
to dig for thoughts (idiom); to search everything for an answer/to rack one's brains
to rack one's brains
to talk nonsense (idiom)/frivolous talk
words and sentences
to pick up what others say (idiom); to pass off other people's opinions as one's own/to parrot
to not know what sb is driving at/to be unintelligible
to harp on/over and over/merely ring changes on a few terms
weighing every word
the king looked left and right and then talked of other things/to digress from the topic of discussion (idiom)
pinyin: wang2 gu4 zuo3 you4 er2 yan2 ta1
